passages.name: pray to the gods
passages.text:
<<set $gods to "red">><<if visited ("tidy your house")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You clasp your hands together and sing a lilting prayer to the gods: to Coinneach, god of justice; to Ceich, god of travellers; to Seonag, god of sports and games; to Micheil, god of healing; to Seathan, god of trade; to Alaxandair and Neacailadh, god and goddess of all that swims in the water... the song winds on, but none answer your call.

[[The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.|gold room]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|tidy your house]]

passages.name: Ledge creep
passages.text:
You hug the wall and creep along the ledge as it curves away from the pool. The slime below you bubbles and gloops, giving off earthy, acrid gases. The further away you get, the darker the cave becomes as the red lights retreat behind you.

You creep along through the gloom, and just as you feel your legs are going to give way and you might fall into the blackness, the ledge broadens and rises and you find yourself in [[an astonishing cavern|huge cave]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|play games]]

passages.name: wash your dishes
passages.text:
<<set $potion to "red">><<if visited ("drink your luck potion")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>Ye gaither thegither plates n mugs fae aroond the hoose. Stackin thaim bi the side o the sink, eydently cleanin thaim oot, findin the best wey tae fit thaim aw intae the rack -- aw feel like pleisurs. Ye gain some sense o wieldins ower yer life.

[[But nou whit?|afternoon]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|drink your luck potion]]

passages.name: Read fail
passages.text:
Ye pick up a poetry beuk. Hit seems wirthy readin, like something that coud mak the day meaninfu. The wirds birl afore yer een, sclyin thegither. Ye rax for a fantasy novel insteid, but ye canna focus on that aither, canna mynd on wha's wha, whit side ye're rootin for. Ye drap baith beuks on the fluir.

Ye deflate back ontae the sofa, n powt at Twitter on yer phone for a wee while. Hauf an oor later ye leuk up, still feelin like ye maun dae something, kennin the maist you can manage is tae [[watch TV]] or [[play gemms|play games]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|Slime dive]]

passages.name: chasing Bob
passages.text:
<<if visited ("o no runes")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>"Hi Brian," ye teep. "Just wanted to check," ye teep, n than CTRL-A-DELETE hit. Ye try "Hope you're well and". Ye try "It's OK if you". Ye try "Tried calling you earlier but". Ye spreid yer paum ower the keybuird n putt it doun. Ye chap delete. Ye chap delete. You chap it fester n haurder n then <<continue "mind on whaur ye are.">>mind on whaur ye are.

<html><font size="5">YE'RE ATTRACTIN ATTENTION. </font><html><<if $damage is 4>><html><font size="5">YE'RE HAEN A MASSIVE PANIC ATTACK. IN PUBLIC. GEMM OWER.</font><html>

passages.name: drink your luck potion
passages.text:
<<set $potion to "red">><<if visited ("wash your dishes")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You reach into your travel sporran for the single vial of Irvine's Luck: an amber potion Elder Rab told you to save for a moment of true peril. You close your eyes, uncork the vial and drink. It burns your throat on the way down. You open your eyes -- and nothing has changed. You throw the vial away in disgust. Rab always was a chancer.

[[The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.|gold room]]

passages.name: Don't go to work
passages.text:
Ye saig intae yer sofa; hit feels a liss. Oorlich, ye dial yer manager's nummer n ye pray for an answerin machine. Ye get wan. Hit daesna mak ye feel better. "A'm sick," ye mou the seestem, hauf-roads true.

Ye think aboot makkin the maist o the day. Ye think aboot [[gangin ootby for a daunder|Outside fail]], kennin that whan ye've the fushion hit can be mendin. Ye think aboot tryin tae [[lin intae some wirthwhile readin|Read fail]] nou ye've the time. But gien up feels saufer n ye leuk tae yer laptop: [[TV|watch TV]] or [[gemms|play games]]? If ye can juist fill eneuch time...

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|Left cave]]

passages.name: THE END
passages.text: [img[THE END. (Image: the inverse of the opening image; now the tiny figure is exiting a cave into the light - or are they entering again?)|raiktheend]] ~ ~ ~ Thank ye for readin n playin. Gemm bi Harry Giles. Biggit in Twine wi additional code bi Leon Arnott. Cover image derived from a photo by Graham MacLennan (some rights reserved). Beta-readin bi Niko Brauer, Sara Clark, Dave Coates, Joey Jones, Darcy Leigh, Hannah Nicklin, and Mercedes Villalba. Gaelic translation o "Ye Cannie Shove Yer Grannie Aff The Bus" bi Gillebride Mac IlleMhaoil via Henry Bell. (Find hit.) Lots o fowk helped but aw the mistaks are mine. This gemm wis inspired bi Depression Quest n bi this bangin post critiquin the systematisation o mental health in gemms like Depression Quest. Hit wis inspired n appalled bi Hugh MacDiarmid n Outlander n the SNP n Kingdoms of Amalur. Thanks tae Arianna Introna wha aksed whit a Crip Scots micht leuk like. Thanks tae Scots-Online, the Centre for the Scots Leid n Scottish Language Dictionaries, ithoot A wadna hae releared ma leid. Thanks tae Porpentine n Anna Anthropy for tutorials n resources n inspiration tae a stranger. Ye can rade whit Scots is aboot for me n whit A'm tryin tae dae wi hit in this airticle (Scots n English). Ye can find resources for managin anxiety n panic attacks here, but aye mynd on that different folk need different approaches. A recommend approaches tae mental health ootside the state n in solidarity, like The Icarus Project n Madlove. If yer juist leukin for unnerstaundin, this post bi Tim Clare is byous. Here's a programme. Nou mak a gemm. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

passages.name: breathe in
passages.text: <<if $breathe1 is "juist" and $breathe2 is "focus" and $breathe3 is "on" and $breathe4 is "yer" and $breathe5 is "braithin">>braithe in. Ye sit doun on the top step n close yer een n braithe in. Ye braithe for a hanlawhile, coonting. The jaws o panic subside wioot brakkin. Ye braithe. The panic onfaw didna hit ye wi fou poust: ye didna faw or black oot. Ye made it throu. Ye're gaun tae be OK.\n\nYe think throu the problem step bi step. Ye tak a step doun the stair, n then anither. Ye get tae the street door. Ye get tae the chippy. Ye order. Ye braithe. Ye pey. Ye cairy the fuid hame. Ye sclim the stair. Ye sit doun. [[Ye braithe|get chips]].<<else>>[[naw naw naw naw naw|maze end]]<<endif>>

passages.name: Crab death
passages.text:
You swing your blade at the crab's claw with a battlecry. It bounces off with a clank, snatched from your hand, and now you feel the second pincer rushing in behind you, opening, closing round your waist, and you see your mother's face, and the diamond edge of the princer tightening, and your breath failing, and <<continue "your vision going dark--">>

<html><font size="5">YOU ARE DEAD. GAME OVER.</font><html>

passages.text:
<<set $walls to "red">><<if visited ("climb the walls")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>Ye redd a spot on the fluir n lie doun tae dae yer raxin. Hit hurts, n it feels braw. The sofa's been murtherin yer back. Ye mebbe coont the seiconts fest, mebbe hap aheid a nummer or twa, but ye wirk yer wey throu the hale routine. Ye dinna feel the pheesical wairmth o a cycle or a daunder, but ye feel something.

[[But nou whit?|afternoon]]

passages.name: Lost North
passages.text:
<<if visited ("Check Twitter")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>Further down the tunnel, the chittering goes quiet, and then there is only your breathing, your footsteps, and the torch flame. You find yourself singing a children's dancing rhyme you can't have heard for a decade. Suddenly, the chittering rises to a scream, and you see teeth, claws, black wings and red eyes. You feel deep, stinging scratches on your arms and face, and stagger, <<continue "swatting at the flock of trows.">>swatting at the flock of trows. 

<html><font size="5">YOU ARE BEING ATTACKED BY TROWS! LOSE 5HP! <<if $damage is 1>>
HP NOW 15/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING.<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

<<timedinsert 1s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 2s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 3s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 4s>>then the floor vanishes beneath you, and you [[hit water with a violent splash|underground river]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: eat some chocolate
passages.text:
<<set $prepare to "red">><<if visited ("prepare for death")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>Thare's a wappin leck o dairk chocolate waitin for this maument. Hit's e'en Fairtred. Ye unwap hit n eat a square, n than anither. The first third o the baur ye let mowten in yer mooth square bi square, the seicont third ye eat in big bites, n the third ye practically bray doun, willin yersel tae feenish the haundlin. The dwaumie ower-indulgence feels byous. Ye gange as ye dicht yer haunds. Hit's the first time ye've smiled theday.

[[But nou whit?|afternoon]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|prepare for death]]

passages.name: Slime dive
passages.text:
You dive as deep as you can and open your eyes. You feel the slime pulling at your hair, your legs, pulling you deeper. The red lights seem to be gathering around you. And you can see nothing; the slime is sucking at your eyes.

You panic and doggy-paddle back to the ledge before exhaustion pulls you below, to the lights. You lie back on the rock and take gulp after gulp of air. The dim light confuses your sense of time -- perhaps you lie there for hours. Eventually, you pick yourself up, knowing that you need to try [[creeping along the ledge|Ledge creep]] or [[climbing the rockface|Climb cliff]] in search of a way out.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Read fail]]

passages.name: Lost East
passages.text:
The ceiling lowers. You fall to a crouch, and then a crawl. Then, suddenly, it opens above you and you are bathed in an intense, painful light. You close your eyes, and when, cautiously, you open them again, you realise that you can see the sky. A wide chimney of stone extends for hundreds of feet above you. You rejoice in the daylight, and then realise just how deep you must be. You stretch, sing a small prayer to the sun, and then move on.

Ten yards town the tunnel, it banks steeply, and you lose your grip. You fall fast, the rock wet beneath you, and then [[hit water with a violent splash|underground river]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Data entry]]

links.text: hit water with a violent splash

passages.text:
<<if $workroom is "green">><<else>><<set $workroom to "green">>A langsome To Do List sweems afore ye on the screen.

You lean back intae yer cheer wi a lang braith.

<<endif>><<if $runes is "green">>Ye've cleared yer inbox. <<else>>Thare's twa oors' wirth o [[emails to answer|Answer emails]].  <<endif>><<if $plants is "green">>Ye've sortit that report.  <<else>>Yer latest [[impack report|Write a report]] is lang owerdue. <<endif>><<if $pool is "green">>N ye canna affuird ony distractions. <<else>>Aye but, ye dinna think ye've got the fushion tae dae onything nou cep [[chack Facebook|splashpool]].<<endif>>

The aiple is haurd n scrinkit but ye ramsh hit doun tae the stem oot o duty. Yer kyte feels fou, but hit still hurts. Ye try tae congratulate yersel for takkin it easy, but ye feel <<continue "naething but failyie.">>naething but failyie.

<html><font size="5">NAETHING YE DAE IS RICHT. <<if $damage is 1>>YE FEEL YER BACKGRUND LEVEL O PANIC RISIN.<<else if $damage is 2>>YER HAIRT WILLNA STAP THUNNERIN IN PANIC<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

passages.name: Swear
passages.text:
Ye lowp back on yer bike n pedal hytely, sweirin. Ye ban the driver, but the taxi's speedin awa, n nou ye're rowstin tae naethin, n ye spy folk glowerin, n cars are hurlin past aither side, nd yer braith habbers, n yer veesion mirks, and ye canna, ye canna, ye, hit's, but, juist, aw shite aw shite <<continue "aw shite--">>

<html><font size="5">YE'RE HAEN A MASSIVE PANIC ATTACK. IN PUBLIC. GEMM OWER.</font><html>

They are immovable, and your knuckles are bloodied. You swing harder and miss, and a gold tip digs deep into your arm, tearing into muscle.

passages.text:
<<if visited ("Lost North")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>Yer feeds kill time n whiles ye lauch, but ye're feart, CTRL-Tin in panic whan somebdy shifts fae thair desk, n as the oors weir in yer <<continue "self-laithin wins at.">>self-laithin wins at.

<html><font size="5">YER WIRK FREAKS YE OOT. <<if $damage is 1>>YE FEEL YER BACKGRUND LEVEL O PANIC RISIN.<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

<<timedinsert 1s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 2s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 3s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 4s>>sae ye chack yer inbox, deletin as mony emails as ye can, n figure nou is an acceptable time for [[lunch]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: Data entry
passages.text:
Ye plug in yer heidphones, appen a spreidsheet, rax for a folder n stairt typin. For a hanlawhile ye loss yersel in a fykie conversion problem. Some chiptune muisic cams on randomiser n ye chap the keybuird in rhythm.

Luckily, whan ye canna tak ony mair, hit's [[time for lunch|lunch]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|Lost East]]

passages.name: clear your desktop
passages.text:
<<set $scream to "red">><<if visited ("scream")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>No really muivin fae the sofa, ye set a weirless moose on yer knee n stairt sortin oot yer cluttert dasktop. Organisin n deletin files feels eneuch like wirk n eneuch like naething tae be manageable; ye mak yer wey throu maist o yer main folders n hae a sense o bringin some kin o order tae the warld.

[[But nou whit?|gold room]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|scream]]

passages.text:
<<set $walls to "red">><<if visited ("do your physio")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You try to gain a purchase on the walls, hoping that if you can reach higher perhaps you can jam the mechanism -- but there is no gap between bricks for you to gain a purchase on, and you fall back to the floor.

[[The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.|gold room]]

<<if $maze is 25>><<if visited ("puzzle door opens")>>Two circles, one inside the other. The outer circle is fixed: around its edge the glowing figures show a wave, then a river, then a forest, a mountain, and the symbol for sky. But the inner circle shifts under your touch, beasts of the land appearing and disappearing: <<cyclinglink $sigil1 "salmon" "capercaillie" "selkie" "osprey" "cow">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil2 "selkie" "salmon" "cow" "capercaillie" "osprey">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil3 "cow" "capercaillie" "selkie" "salmon" "osprey">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil4 "osprey" "selkie" "salmon" "cow" "capercaillie">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil5 "capercaillie" "salmon" "cow" "selkie" "osprey">>.

In the centre of the door, there is [[a fiery sun|puzzle door opens]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|no scottify]]<<else>>you turn and come to a great stone door lit by a flickering torch. You breathe steadily for what seems like the first time in hours. This must be it. You recognise the runes on the door as the marks of the Order of the Salmon. The Staff is close.

You lean against the door. The stone seems warm. It seems to move beneath you. You open your eyes and see that glowing sigils have appeared on its surface. As you brush against them they change shape. Two circles, one inside the other. The outer circle is fixed: around its edge the glowing figures show a wave, then a river, then a forest, a mountain, and the symbol for sky. But the inner circle shifts under your touch, beasts of the land appearing and disappearing: <<cyclinglink $sigil1 "salmon" "capercaillie" "selkie" "osprey" "cow">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil2 "selkie" "salmon" "cow" "capercaillie" "osprey">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil3 "cow" "capercaillie" "selkie" "salmon" "osprey">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil4 "osprey" "selkie" "salmon" "cow" "capercaillie">>, <<cyclinglink $sigil5 "capercaillie" "salmon" "cow" "selkie" "osprey">>.

passages.name: Flee crab
passages.text:
You jump past the crab with a curse and its pincer slams into the wall behind you.

You sprint away before it can turn, your torch's flame guttering in the rush of air. The tunnel forks, and forks again -- you choose at random until you can no longer hear the terrible clacking behind you.

Your chest heaving, you take stock, and realise that Bàirneach is gone. Grabbed by a pincer or lost in the tunnels, you cannot tell. You must get her back. But, looking around, you discover you can't tell which direction you came from, or which direction you should go. Deep shadows run over the cave walls.

There's a putrid, bloody smell [[rising from the tunnel behind you|Lost South]]. You feel warm air on your face as you turn [[to your right|Lost East]], and a faint chittering  in the distance [[to your left|Lost North]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Head down]]

links.text: rising from the tunnel behind you

passages.name: First Steps in the Cave
passages.text:
The gaping cave mouth closes in and drops sharply, becoming a tunnel descending into the earth. Its cold walls narrow, and soon you're squeezing past sharp juts of stone that snatch at your arms and legs. For a moment you are held fast, your heart juddering as you imagine becoming forever trapped underground, and then the tunnel abruptly opens into <<continue "a cavern">>a cavern <<continue "singing with light">>singing with light <<continue  "and water.">>and water.

A magnificent waterfall gushes from the sheer rock wall high above you. As it crashes into the floor, the spray catches the light of your torch -- but no, the whole cavern is also lit by clusters of gowing crystals sprouting from the rock, firing <<continue "blue, green, silver, gold.">>blue, green, silver, gold.

You stare and the torrent of water as the many lights play off it, imagining that strange scenes are appearing on its surface. You think for a moment that you can see Ruaraidh's face, mouth open in a scream, and then you see <<continue "a great round ship sailing through the sky.">>a great round ship sailing through the sky.

It is an illusion. You realise you have been watching the lightshow for a full span of minutes, your feet rooted to the rock. You blink and look away, remembering your quest. You can see two ways out from here -- [[following the stream of water as it gushes away|Left cave]], or entering [[a tunnel leading from behind the fall|Right cave]]. It is impossible to tell which might lead to the Chamber of the Staff.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Translate to Scots</font>|Getting Up]]

links.text: following the stream of water as it gushes away
a tunnel leading from behind the fall

passages.name: look in the cupboards
passages.text: Ye find eneuch in the fridge tae [[bung thegither some sort o salad|salad]], n mebbe ye coud e'en fry up some tofu for protein. Hit'd tak an unco bang, but mebbe nutrition woud gie ye eneuch virr tae actually dae something this efternuin. Still, in the cubbarts ye find [[a pairty-size poke o crisps n an aiple whit needs eatin|crisps and an apple]] -- ye coud juist fesh thaim tae the sofa the nou.\n\n[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|find a way out]]

links.text: bung thegither some sort o salad
a pairty-size poke o crisps n an aiple whit needs eatin

passages.name: Go to work
passages.text:
Ye rug yersel aff the sofa, throwe yer work bag thegither, brattle doun the stair n lowp on yer bike.

This is guid, ye think. Keep muivin. Ye slaw yer pechin, find yer rhythm, sclim the lang brae intae toun, flaucht throu traffic, movin.

A blare o horn. A taxi pous oot in afore ye on the roondaboot, n ye baith daud yer brakes. Ye pou ower tae the crib tae cower fae the gliff, n the taxi hurls aff. 

Ye want tae [[chase efter the bangster driver n teir|Swear]], but ye shoud mebbe [[juist keep yer heid doun|Head down]]. Ye dinna need this.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|Right cave]]

passages.name: pool lever
passages.text:
<<set $pool to "green">>You take a deep breath, and kick yourself under water. Grasping the lever, you wrench, a stream of bubbles pouring from your mouth. It comes to with a great clunk and you float to the surface. The grotto echoes with the deafening multi-layered drone of the war-pipes -- but no player is in sight.

<<if $plants is "green" and $runes is "green" and $pool is "green">>The drone, drum and fiddle rise together, their deafening music filling the cavern. You clutch your hands to your ears. The room fills with an ethereal mist and joining the music is [[a terrible grinding of stone on stone.|waterfall parts]]<<else>>And there's [[still no exit|pool]] to be found.<<endif>>

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|close that tab]]

links.text: a terrible grinding of stone on stone.

passages.name: concentrate
passages.text:
<<set $plants to "green">>Somewey, ye dae a hauf-dacent job. Eneuch tae keep insensin the Buird yer wirk is wirthwhile, onywey, e'en if hit daesna insense you. Ye're no proud, but ye like the liss.

<<if $plants is "green" and $runes is "green" and $pool is "green">>Ye leuk til the clock again n tremmle wi the liss. Hit's time tae [[gang hame.|home time]]<<else>>Ye wiss thare wasna that muckle [[time tae fill.|work afternoon]]<<endif>>

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|plants lever]]

passages.name: bellow his name
passages.text:
<<if visited ("Call him")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>"Ruaraidh!" bellow. "Ruaraidh!" And his name comes back to you, echoing round the cavern: RUUUAAARRRUUUAAARRRAAA... The noise is so deafening you do not hear the stalactite shaking loose and crashing down on top of you until it is almost too late. You dive out of the way, but the shards of rock shower over you, <<continue "cutting into your legs and arms.">>cutting into your legs and arms.

<html><font size="5">A STALACTITE FELL ON YOU! LOSE 5HP!<<if $damage is 1>>
HP NOW 15/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING.<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

<<timedinsert 1s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 2s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 3s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 4s>>and you still need to [[find a way out|look in the cupboards]].<<endtimedinsert>>

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Call him]]

passages.name: look at your bookmarks
passages.text:
<<set $goldlever to "red">><<if visited ("find a lever")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>Ye appen the list o things ye war gaun tae read later, peedie gemms ye war gaun tae play, news stories ye meant tae get a grip o, bonnie things ye meant tae tweet. Ye delete hauf o thaim, file maist o the ither hauf awa, n skim-read twa airticles. Ye dinna feel great aboot hit, but ye're gled tae hae collt or hid futur soorces o guilt. Till thay big up again.

[[But nou whit?|afternoon]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|find a lever]]

passages.name: through the door
passages.text:
You squeeze through the gap just as the ceiling slams into the floor with a terrible screaming crash. You pull yourself to your knees and feel a tug -- the merciless spikes have ripped your travel sporran from you, tethering you by a thin leather strap. You tear the strap free and think of the lost rations. Your waterskin too is gone. You turn your mind instead to your quest for the Staff. If you can find its resting place, everything else will follow.

An orb of fuzzy light hangs in front of you. Behind you, the rock wall stretches into darkness in either direction, as if you were in a cavern of unimaginable size. You resolve to step forward into the darkness, when the orb darts away. You follow it to another rock wall, and then round a corner, and then it dashes up, and out of reach, and vanishes to a point, and you are left in utter [[darkness|cave maze start]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|afternoon end]]

passages.name: Answer emails
passages.text:
Ye file n delete n answer as eydently as ye can. This is something ye can dae -- a semple, ranin darg, like degroutin the cludgie tiles. Ye build up steam n the clock seems tae be muivin.

Than ye mind on ye still hae tae find some wey o [[chasin Brian|chasing Bob]] aboot his monitorin data. The later he gets, the haurder hit feels tae contack him. Ye wunner if, three fluirs doun, he's govin at the screen wi the same feelin as you. Ye wunner if thare's some wey you coud juist [[sling a deifie|avoid it]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|runes]]

passages.name: Getting Up
passages.text:
Ye get in the shour n heeld intae the on button. The watter's plot het n comfortin, n yer finger-nebs are crynen whan ye fotch hit aff. Ye think aboot gettin back intae bed even nou, but ye taw yersel <<continue "intae">>intae <<continue "the">>the <<continue "kitchen">>kitchen.

Toast, marmite, cereal, soy milk. Ye lean on the coonter n ower leuk yer brakfast: hit's a cunyie, hit's a hing-on, an easement, a grue. Ye try at seein hit as fuel but <<continue "hit stairts to saur like wecht.">>hit stairts to saur like wecht.

Ye laid up the neist episode o the X-Files to distract ye as ye ramsh. Hit flowes fine as lang as ye haud the structural racism oot o shot. Mulder's a bam. His pus leuks tuim. Ye're ten meenits afore the end afore ye realise whit time it is: <<continue "late.">>late.

Ye're stickit tae the sofa. Ye coud [[gang tae work|Go to work]], but [[gien up n bidin hame|Don't go to work]] feels that mair eith. Aither wey, ye juist need tae mak hit throu the day.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Translate to English.</font>|First Steps in the Cave]]

passages.name: Phone call
passages.text:
Ye pick up the phone. Yer haund stairts shakkin. Awbdy in the office is glaumin. Yer chaft appens n closes. Shite fuck naw no nou no aye but <<continue "naw nou no fuck shite aw god...">>naw nou no fuck shite aw god...

<html><font size="5">YE'RE HAEN A MASSIVE PANIC ATTACK. IN PUBLIC. GEMM OWER.</font><html>

passages.name: find a way out
passages.text: You believe you've found a passageway leading from the cavern, a little way along an impossibly deep cavern suddenly opens at your feet. You can see the other side -- just, you think, [[within reach of a leap|chasm jump]] -- but you keep searching. There's a narrow gash in the wall, almost entirely covered by the luminescent moss, but with a deep glow coming from within. You think you could [[squeeze through|gap crawl]], but it too seem perilous. You have a sudden vision of being trapped here forever by the walls of rock.\n\n[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|look in the cupboards]]

passages.name: afternoon
passages.text:
<<if $time is 5>>Juist as ye're runnin oot o weys tae murther time, ye leuk aince mair til the clock. 5.30pm. [[At last.|afternoon end]]<<else>><<if $afternoon is "green">><<else>><<set $afternoon to "green">>Thare's a wee orange traffic cone in the mids o the black screen. Anither episode ower. Ye CTRL-Q n leuk at yer desktop: a deas o To Do Lists n unsortit dounlaids.

<<endif>>If ye can get tae hauf five, mebbe ye can get tae dinner, than mebbe ye can get tae bed. The oors are an unchancy brig ower a gauntin gloup. passages.name: huge cave
passages.text:
You can't see the roof, and each step echoes round this massive space, somehow never vanishing, staying on the edge of hearing. A luminescent moss growing up the walls weakly illuminates extraordinary forms -- waves and falls of rock, frozen in time. The cavern is full of whispers.

You think about Ruaraidh, trapped in a form almost his own, but still so far from you. You long for him. You want to [[shout his name into the darkness|Call him]]. But you need focus. You need to [[find a way out]]. And find the Staff, so that you can see Ruaraidh once more.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Lunch time]]

links.text: shout his name into the darkness

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: Harry Giles

passages.name: afternoon end
passages.text:
Ye made hit. Ye ken the mairkers o time mean nocht in thaimsels, that hit's aw meaninless, but somehou hit gets ye throu. Hit's like ye've wun something, some wee braig. Like ye've biggit up a scran o vieve. Ye need tae get denner, n ye think ye hae the pith tae gang ootside. Ye grab yer keys n appen yer front door n blaud intae a waw o panic.

Ye canna dae this. Thare's nae wey ye can nivver canna but no this nae nae chaunce but canna canna n naw ye canna ye canna [[naw naw naw--|panic maze start]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|through the door]]

passages.name: no scottify
passages.text: You see a vision of yourself -- can it be you? surely not? -- sitting at the head of a long grey stair, head in your hands, hair shorter now, panting with exhaustion, rocking back and forth, and you look into your own eyes, and\n\nyou [[shake your head|end maze]]

passages.name: play games
passages.text: Ye appen the philome.la feed n click twa-three teetles that leuk interestin. Mebbe thare's something guid here, but ye canna get intae hit, like e'en if thay were guid ye coudna tell. Sae ye close the brouser n stairt a Batman gemm insteid. Hit's glaikit n dreich n donnert n mismade, but it keeps feedin ye aizles n dingles o positive feedback n ye get tae lewder fowk in the pus, ower n ower. Yer kyte stairts tae reemle. Ye ignore it till [[hit hurts|Lunch time]]. [[Anglify|Ledge creep]]

passages.name: waterfall parts
passages.text:
As silvery mist begins to clear, you discover that a great portal has opened in the rock wall of the grotto. Whether opened by ancient, hidden devices or an even older magic, the way forward is clear.

You step through, and the last strain of the pipes fades away. But shockwaves are passing through these underground passages -- a stalactite crashes down just behind you, and the glowing crystals are crumbling from the walls.

Suddenly, the roof of the portal collapses in an avalanche of stone, and you are shut into [[a thundering darkness|cave maze start]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|home time]]

passages.name: Swim back
passages.text:
You try to keep your head above the surface, the slime sucking at your legs and the red lights gathering in a swarm beneath you. You reach the chute and begin to haul yourself back up, but slide straight back in with a gruesome squelch. And again, and again.

Eventually, you decide to swim back to the ledge before exhaustion pulls you below, to the lights. You lie back on the rock and take gulp after gulp of air. The dim light confuses your sense of time -- perhaps you lie there for hours. Eventually, you pick yourself up, knowing that you need to try [[creeping along the ledge|Ledge creep]] or [[climbing the rockface|Climb cliff]] in search of a way out.

passages.name: runes
passages.text:
They're runes! Riatan runes! By the roof of the world, but you know many old tongue-speakers who would pay dearly to see this rare display of the ancient script.

You cannot make sense of what they might mean, but you believe you know how to [[sound the runes|o no runes]]. Riatan magic was powerful, though, and there is no telling what the root-words might work. Even committing them to memory might be dangerous. Following the lines of script, you see that they are gathering towards what appears to be a lever carved from the rock wall. Whoever wrote this clearly meant that [[lever to be pulled|runes lever]].

passages.name: runes lever
passages.text:
<<set $runes to "green">>Blinking the runes from your mind, you grab the stone lever and pull. It grinds towards you, and suddenly you hear a rolling beat from somewhere deep within the rock. The sound reminds you of a battle-drum, like your younger sister used to play before the curse of Black Edward made her hands and fingers like brittle twigs.

<<if $plants is "green" and $runes is "green" and $pool is "green">>The drone, drum and fiddle rise together, their deafening music filling the cavern. You clutch your hands to your ears. The room fills with an ethereal mist and joining the music is [[a terrible grinding of stone on stone.|waterfall parts]]<<else>>You think of her now, and your quest, as you search the grotto [[for an exit.|pool]]<<endif>>

passages.name: Opening: English
passages.text:
You're <<continue "here.">>here.

You're standing at the great mouth of Cave of Uamh. Your long red hair stirs in a breath of air coming from deep inside -- a gust that sounds almost like a word, or a snatch of song. Your battleplaid is torn and dusty, your travel sporran nearly empty, but you know: here you will find <<continue "the end of your journey.">>the end of your journey.

It has been a five year quest. You have made firm friends -- and lost them. You have journeyed up the rocky Venomous Mountain, over the Burning River, across the scattered Horse Isles where no trees grow. You are searching for the Staff of the Salmon, whose magic alone will release your clan from the withering curse of Black Edward. You shudder as you think of your parents, of Ruaraidh, your paramour, rooted to the earth, skin like bark, eyes black, blood slow as sap<<continue "...">>...

A giant eagle circles overhead. You unsheathe your clanblade, Bàirneach, passed down from your mother to you, and from her mother to her, and so on further back than any tale tells, and you step into [[the darkness of Uamh|First Steps in the Cave]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">What's this nonsense? Translate to Scots.</font>|Opening: Scots]]

passages.name: towards the MacGuffin
passages.text:
Walk carefully across the floor, paying your respects to the histories of <<continue "wars long past.">>wars long past.

Dust down <<continue "your worn battleplaid.">>your worn battleplaid.

Sense the animal faces watching you as you pass, <<continue "judging you worthy.">>judging you worthy.

Slow as you approach the altar, the sacred Staff lit by <<continue "a glow from within.">>a glow from within.

<<continue "Climb the steps.">>Climb the steps.

Pick up [[the Staff|get the MacGuffin]].

passages.name: splashpool
passages.text: You lean over the pool -- still, and reflecting the lightshow above. You think you see something glittering beneath the surface, and dive in. The water is somehow warm and soft; for a moment, you imagine being held. Then you see it: [[a huge golden shell|funny video]], a grottie buckie, lying on the pool floor. It rolls away as you pass over, and just beyond it you see -- is that a [[lever|close that tab]]?\n\n[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Check Facebook]]

passages.name: plants lever
passages.text:
<<set $plants to "green">>You screw up your nose and grab the lever. As you pull, bubbles of lurid fungus fall and burst, filling the air with sweet, metallic spores. When the lever clunks into place, a wavering note echoes round the walls, as if a horsehair bow were being drawn across a string. But there's no fiddler you can see.

<<if $plants is "green" and $runes is "green" and $pool is "green">>The drone, drum and fiddle rise together, their deafening music filling the cavern. You clutch your hands to your ears. The room fills with an ethereal mist and joining the music is [[a terrible grinding of stone on stone.|waterfall parts]]<<else>>Just like there's [[still no exit|pool]] to be found.<<endif>>

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|concentrate]]

links.text: a terrible grinding of stone on stone.

passages.name: search the floor
passages.text:
<<set $floor to "red">><<if visited ("put on laundry")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You fall to your knees and pass your hands frantically over the gold plates, pushing, feeling the edges. None of them give, and the gaps between them are barely wide enough for your fingernails. There is nothing to help you here.

[[The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.|afternoon]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|put on laundry]]

links.text: The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.

passages.name: Left cave
passages.text:
Two steps down the passageway and your feet skid from under you! You slither down a slick stone chute -- and then the pool of slime at the bottom swallows you with a satisfied gloop. Struggling, your mouth filling with brown gunk, you somehow manage to pull yourself onto a narrow rock ledge over the pool. It bubbles ominously beneath you.

You torch is long gone beneath the surface, but strange red lights are moving through the gloop, illuminating the cave. Still, you can see no obvious way out. You could [[dive back in|Slime dive]] to see what lies beneath, or try to [[swim back to the tunnel|Swim back]] you slid down. [[The ledge curves away from you|Ledge creep]] and may offer some means of escape, and the rock cliff seems to have [[enough handholds for a risky climb|Climb cliff]]. You wipe slime from your eyes and remember your mission: you must find a way out, and find the Staff.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Don't go to work]]

links.text: The ledge curves away from you
enough handholds for a risky climb

passages.name: gap crawl
passages.text:
<<if visited ("crisps and an apple")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>You breathe in and squeeze through the gap. Halfway through, you realise you cannot move in either direction. The rock is gripping you; each limb pinned to the damp walls. You wrench yourself forwards and hear a crack -- from the pain in your chest, a rib. As you fall to the floor on the other side, the rock slams shut behind you, its mouth closing. You realise it has taken Bàirneach with it. You pound at the rock in tears, <<continue "but nothing gives way.">>but nothing gives way.

<html><font size="5">YOU WERE CRUSHED BY LIVING ROCK! LOSE 5HP!<<if $damage is 1>>
HP NOW 15/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING.<<else if $damage is 2>>HP NOW 10/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING AND DISORIENTED.<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

<<set $goldlever to "green">><<set $floor to "green">><<set $rockfall to "green">><<set $tiles to "green">><<set $walls to "green">><<set $spikes to "green">><<set $potion to "green">><<set $gods to "green">><<set $prepare to "green">><<set $scream to "green">><<timedinsert 1s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 2s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 3s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 4s>>turning round, you realise you are in [[a room of solid gold|gold room]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: Head down
passages.text:
"Shite," ye say tae yersel, n lowp back on yer bike.

In the office, ye heid tae yer bank o desks n mak on a smile n say "Guid mornin!" Twa-three heids turn n nod. Ye jouk intae yer spot afore onybdy speirs ye.

Rowes o desks surroond ye. Ye hate the fowk govin at thair screens for bein antisocial, n ye hate the fowk bletherin at the watter byler for bein social. Ye gove at yer ain screen.

Ye mind on that Brian's a week ahint sendin his monitorin data tae ye. Ye ocht tae [[caw him|Phone call]], but the thocht o pickin up the phone maks ye scudder, maks yer hairt lounder at yer ribs. Thare's a muckle ruck o [[data entry|Data entry]] ye've been pitten aff n aw. Ye think aboot [[checkin Twitter instead|Check Twitter]] if naebdy's watchin. But awthing feels chancy.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|Flee crab]]

passages.name: chasm jump
passages.text:
<<if visited ("salad")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>You begin to run, focussing on the point where your feet must leave the tunnel floor. You imagine the arc of your leap, the force with which you must push off, the landing. Halfway across, you have a moment to recognise that you're falling short before you crash violently into the side of the chasm -- just high enough to grap the lip. You scramble and haul yourself over the edge -- alive, but with an ache in your chest that means <<continue "at least one broken rib.">>at least one broken rib.

<html><font size="5">YOU NEARLY FELL INTO A BOTTOMLESS PIT! LOSE 5HP!<<if $damage is 1>>
HP NOW 15/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING.<<else if $damage is 2>>HP NOW 10/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING AND DISORIENTED.<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

You duck through a low bend, and suddenly a great boulder crashes down behind you. You leap clear -- and find yourself now in a [[room of solid gold|gold room]].<<endtimedinsert>>

Ye try tae congratulate yersel for daen a guid thing, but yeu feel <<continue "naething but failyie.">>naething but failyie.

passages.name: bed
passages.text: Hit hasna been a guid day. Ye're leeing in bed, n ye're aboot tae turn on a audiobook sae yer mynd has something tae listen tae ither than hits ain catalog o failyies. Hit's a fantasy yarn; yestreen ye fell alseep juist as the hero foond thir magic artefact, n whit happens nou micht lull ye doun. Ye hurt. But ye haudit the crottles o yersel thegither for anither day.\n\nN mebbe [[the morn will be better|THE END]].

passages.name: o no runes
passages.text:
<<if visited ("chasing Bob")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>You begin, uncertainly, to sound the runes: "o chan... chan fhaod thu do... sheanmhair a phutadh bhar... a bhus..." But as the sound of the last rune leaves your lips, you feel as though a great claw is raking up your chest, through your plaid, your skin, your ribs. <<continue "It begins to squeeze.">>It begins to squeeze.

<html><font size="5">YOU'VE SUMMONED A MONSTER INSIDE YOUR HEART! LOSE 5HP!</font><html>

passages.name: puzzle door opens
passages.text: <<if $sigil1 is "selkie" and $sigil2 is "salmon" and $sigil3 is "capercaillie" and $sigil4 is "cow" and $sigil5 is "osprey">>You press your hand to the sun, and it flares, bright, warm. The door grinds open, the ancient harmonics singing across the temple before you. A pillared chamber, carved directly into this deep rock. This is the Shrine of the Salmon. You are here.\n\nPanels of glowing quartz in the ceiling light your way. Every surface is covered in ancient runes of extraordinary power. The floor carvings tell a history of the Fourteen Clans; the pillars are wreathed in spellwork; the walls depict the faces of the land's sacred animals. And at the end of the chamber, laid across an altar, [[the Staff of the Salmon|towards the MacGuffin]].<<else>>You press your hand to the sun, but [[nothing happens|end maze]].<<endif>>

passages.name: ferns
passages.text: Among the bubbles of orange, you see streaks of blue and silver. The fungus smells of iron and sugar, and you remember how hungry you are. You pull out a handful and consider [[eating it|berries]] -- and then, through the gap, in the centre of the pillar, you see, of all things, [[a lever|plants lever]].\n\n[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Write a report]]

passages.name: Climb cliff
passages.text:
You wipe your slime-streaked hands on your battleplaid, reach up, and find a grip. The cliff is cracked and jagged enough to provide holds, but it cuts and scrapes. Still, you find a rhythm. The climb gets darker as the pool retreats beneath you; your fingers are growing numb, and you try not to think about falling. 

But eventually, after a long time, you pull yourself onto another long ledge -- a broad crack in the rock that, you now discover, opens out into [[an astonishing cavern|huge cave]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|watch TV]]

passages.name: Right cave
passages.text:
The light dims as the tunnel twists and then begins to climb.

You begin to hear a strange clacking sound, but you can't tell if it's coming from in front or behind. You slow down, creeping up the slope.

You turn a corner and walk straight into a pair of monstrous, jug-sized eyes. They extend on stalks, and the stalks are attached to an enormous crab, its back encrusted with jewels, its great princers now swinging open towards you.

You draw back Bàirneach to [[strike at its eyes|Crab death]], but then you see an opening on the left through which [[you could flee|Flee crab]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|Go to work]]

passages.name: avoid it
passages.text:
<<set $runes to "green">>Ye decide Brian daesna maiter, that the universe is hyowj, that naebdy will tak tent, n ye close the compose windae. Thare's a blenk o scowth, a slap ye can skite throu tae feenish empien yer inbox. Whan ye're daen, the "No new emails!" message is lauchin at ye.

<<if $plants is "green" and $runes is "green" and $pool is "green">>Ye leuk til the clock again n tremmle wi the liss. Hit's time tae [[gang hame.|home time]]<<else>>N thare's still [[mair time tae kill afore ye can gang hame|work afternoon]].<<endif>>

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|runes lever]]

links.text: mair time tae kill afore ye can gang hame

passages.name: get the MacGuffin
passages.text: As you grasp the Staff you hear a blast of warpipes -- whether summoned by magic or purely in your head, you cannot tell, and it hardly matters. You imagine another version of yourself, who stayed in bed that fateful day and even now lies frozen in time, unable to act, an endless scream seeking only relief. But here and now you hold in your hands the end of your quest: the ancient artefact that can lift the curse of Black Edward and set your clan free. You have triumphed.\n\nNow [[you just have to get out.|THE END]]

links.text: you just have to get out.

passages.name: gold room
passages.text:
<<if $time is 5>>There is a ripping, screeching sound, and a golden panel tears free from the wall! Behind it, you see a passage -- and [[escape!|through the door]]<<else>><<if $goldroom is "green">><<else>><<set $goldroom to "green">>You gape at the sight before you: the walls are built from huge gold bricks, the floor from gold plate; a gold statue of a stag rears in the centre, as large as life. Everything seems to glow from within: the room is rich with light. Then you look up.

<<endif>>The ceiling is a forest of spikes -- also pure gold. And with a screeching, grinding wail, it starts to lower. The rockfall has sealed the portal behind you, and there is no door. The spikes are lowering and now you can see blood on their tips. You desperately search for some possibility, whether there might be some way out if you could find it<<if $goldlever is "green">>, [[find a lever]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $floor is "green">>, [[search the floor|put on laundry]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $rockfall is "green">>, [[clear the rockfall]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $tiles is "green">>, [[pound the tiles|pound the floor]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $walls is "green">>, [[climb the walls]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $spikes is "green">>, [[attack the spikes]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $potion is "green">>, [[drink your luck potion]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $gods is "green">>, [[pray to the gods]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $scream is "green">>, or just [[scream|clear your desktop]]<<else>><<endif>><<if $prepare is "green">>. But you fear that now there is only time to make your peace with fate and [[prepare for death]]<<else>><<endif>>...

<<if $time is 0>>The ceiling has begun its relentless descent towards you!<<else if $time is 1>>The ceiling is grinding ever lower!<<else if $time is 2>>The spikes have descended to nearly head height!<<else if $time is 3>>The merciless spikes have forced you into a crouch!<<else if $time is 4>>The spikes are bearing down on you, glinting gold!<<else if $time is 5>>There is a ripping, screeching sound, and a golden panel tears free from the wall! Behind it, you see a passage -- and [[escape!|through the door]]<<endif>><<endif>>

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|afternoon]]

passages.text:
<<set $tiles to "red">><<if visited ("pound the floor")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>Ye dial n let it ring oot. Ye ken he's juist at wirk n canna answer the nou, but ye dae hit onywey. Than ye dae hit again. Ye canna tell if ye're desperate for easedom or desperate tae hurt yersel. Ye dae hit a third tim, n ye feel the rings speedin up, like yer hairt is speedin up, n thare's a dirdin in yer lugs...

<html><font size="5">YE'RE SEL-SABOTAGIN. </font><html><<if $damage is 4>><html><font size="5">YE'RE HAEN A MASSIVE PANIC ATTACK. THARE'S NAE HELP. GEMM OWER.</font><html>

passages.name: home time
passages.text:
Ye've wirked yer contractit seiven oors. Maist o yer office is still teepin, but if onybdy were tae speir, ye coud justify gaun hame. Naebdy speirs. Ye gie a wee waff, n yer manager smiles in reply.

Ye bike home, brain maistly empie, anely juist mindin on tae stop for lichts n chack for cars, thinkin juist o pitten something in yer kyte n sprauchlin intae bed suin as ye can.

At yer front door, ye realise thare's naething in the fridge. Ye blaud intae a waw o panic. Ye canna dae this. Thare's nae wey ye can nivver canna but no this nae nae chaunce but canna canna n naw ye canna ye canna [[naw naw naw--|panic maze start]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|waterfall parts]]

passages.name: maze end
passages.text:
ye canna see ye canna but this but maun ye need tae ye juist need tae ye

mind on thare's a naw thare's nae thare's a wey ye maun ye ye ye need tae <<cyclinglink $breathe1 "focus" "juist" "naw" "but" "maun">> <<cyclinglink $breathe2 "nivver" "braithin" "nivver" "naw" "focus">> <<cyclinglink $breathe3 "yer" "on" "help" "canna" "lost">> <<cyclinglink $breathe4 "on" "yer" "deid" "die" "panic">> <<cyclinglink $breathe5 "braithin" "juist" "braithin">>

[[n close yer een n|breathe in]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|no anglify]]

passages.name: Lost South
passages.text:
The floor gives way beneath you. You turn in the air for an impossibly long time and then a great bone spike rises from the darkness and <<continue "crashes through your skull.">>crashes through your skull.

<html><font size="5">YOU ARE DEAD. GAME OVER.</font><html>

<<timedinsert 1s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 2s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 3s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 4s>>[[mash the undo button?|Undo]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: prepare for death
passages.text:
<<set $prepare to "red">><<if visited ("eat some chocolate")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You sit on the floor and close your eyes. You say goodbye to your family, to the clan-tree and the land of your ancestors. You say goodbye to your lost sword and your lost love. You send a final wish into the future, a wish you've held in your heart since childhood, and wait for death. But the terrible screech is still slowly descending.

[[The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.|gold room]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|eat some chocolate]]

links.text: The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.

passages.name: Check Facebook
passages.text: The strone o vainity posts n viral content n poleetical stramash feels awmaist reassurin. Ye click a curn o likes n try tae think o it as strenthenin social bonds. A [[cat video|pearl]] comes up that leuks unpossibly cute; ye smirk, than keek roond to spy if ondybdy haes seen ye smirkin. Ye want tae [[click it|pearl]], but ye shoud [[close the windae|pool lever]]. \n\n[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|splashpool]]

passages.name: underground river
passages.text:
<<if visited ("lunch")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>Your torch goes out and is <<continue "stolen away by the river.">>stolen away by the river.

But there's a glow coming from the water, a wavering <<continue "algal bloom.">>algal bloom.

You wade through the greenish darkness, <<continue "against the current.">>against the current.

The water chills your <<continue "weary limbs.">>weary limbs.

Something moving <<continue "against your">>against your

a tickling <<continue "shudder by">>shudder by

legs <<continue "rushing past">>rushing past

and now was <<continue "that">>that

teeth or <<continue "spines">>spines

kelpie <<continue "braying">>braying

dive <<continue "forward">>forward

crack <<continue "your">>your

<<continue "head">>head

<<if $damage is 1>>HP NOW 15/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING.<<else if $damage is 2>>HP NOW 10/20. YOU ARE BLEEDING AND DISORIENTED.<<else>><<print $damage>><<endif>></font><html>

<<timedinsert 1s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 2s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 3s>>.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 4s>>and when you regain consciousness you are lying on the shore of [[a deep, wide pool|pool]] lit by stars.<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.text:
<<if $poolroom is "green">><<else>><<set $poolroom to "green">>No, not stars: huge clusters of fireflies gathering around a forest of stalactites, illuminating the grotto.

You pick yourself up and look around you. Your travel sporran is gone, your waterskin and last rations of oats with it, lost somewhere in the river. And you can see no way out.

<<endif>><<if $plants is "green">>A wavering long note echoes round the cavern. <<else>>A [[strange orange fungus|ferns]] is growing across the floor of this cavern, building up into bulbous pillars. <<endif>><<if $pool is "green">>A pipe drone is rising from the floor. <<else>>The [[pool before you|Check Facebook]] is deep and still. <<endif>><<if $runes is "green">>A drum is pounding in the walls. <<else>>The walls of this cavern are [[covered with marks|runes]] that cannot have been carved by water.<<endif>>

<<set $floor to "red">><<if visited ("search the floor")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>Ye bunnle up the claes fae the fluir n stech thaim in the washin machine. Hit's like eneuch owerlaidit, n ye ken ye're like eneuch tae forgat tae unlaid hit later, but ye daud the door shut wi a sense o achievement onywey.

[[But nou whit?|gold room]]

<<set $tiles to "red">><<if visited ("phone your boyfriend")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You sink to your knees and pound the gold floorplates. You hit harder and harder, desperate for something to give. You pull your arm back and punch the floor with all your might -- and feel something break in your hand with a fiery burst of pain.

passages.name: Lunch time
passages.text:
Ye need tae mak lunch. Get somethin intae ye. Basic self-mainteenance. Ye try tae redd yer mind n think aboot hou fuid wirks. 

Ye need help. Ye're no shuir ye can dae this alane. Ye think aboot [[phonin your boyfreend|bellow his name]], but ken he's maist like wirkin n ye dinna want tae interrupt. Ye juist need tae [[rype the cubbarts|look in the cupboards]] n airt oot whit's possible.

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|huge cave]]

passages.name: Opening: Scots
passages.text:
Ye <<continue "wauken.">>wauken.

Yont the windae-rinds ye feel the gray lew o mornin. Ye gell. Ye're rackt wi the echas o yestreen's panic-onfaw: sair limms, stoondin heid, doutsome mynd. Hit's hauf seiven n ye pit on yer glesses n ye ken ithoot quaisten: <<continue "ye willna be able tae shak this amp aw day.">>ye willna be able tae shak this amp aw day.

Hit's lang-kent. Some days ye wauken tae this bummin in the backgrund: no ye canna why'd ye fail ye'll fail awthing ye dae ye are is mankit no thare's no wey no wey oot n nocht ye shoud ken you shoud juist gie no gie wey gie ower<<continue "...">>...

The whitemaws are yatterin ootby. Ye straiten yer mooth. Ye rug back yer duvet n [[get up|Getting Up]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Whit's this haivers? Translate tae English.</font>|Opening: English]]

links.text: <font color = "#D72B8C">Whit's this haivers? Translate tae English.</font>

passages.name: watch TV
passages.text:
Ye watch anither episode o the X-Files. Wan mair, ye tell yersel. Sae ye can big yer fushion. Hit turns oot tae be a fairly offensive episode but ye cave tae cark. The screen gaes blank n ye think aboot yer emails, than click tae Twitter insteid. Twa fowk favourited a bourd ye made yesterday. Ye appen anither episode. This conteenas for a muckle stoond.

Yer kyte stairts tae reemle. You ignore it till [[hit hurts|Lunch time]].

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Anglify</font>|Climb cliff]]

passages.name: berries
passages.text:
<<if visited ("half-ass it")>><<else>><<set $damage += 1>><<endif>>The first flake of orange fungus fizzes pleasantly on your tongue. You laugh and begin scoffing it down -- but a minute later you're gripping your stomach and there's <<continue "an acrid foam bubbling from your lips.">>an acrid foam bubbling from your lips.

<html><font size="5">YOU'VE BEEN POISONED BY IRN FUNGUS! LOSE 5HP!</font><html>
<<if $damage is 4>><html><font size="5">HP NOW 0/20. YOU ARE DEAD. GAME OVER.</font><html>

passages.name: scream
passages.text:
<<set $scream to "red">><<if visited ("clear your desktop")>><<else>><<set $time += 1>><<endif>>You scream for every friend you've lost and for the trapped souls in your clanlands. You scream higher than the Venomous Mountain, more raging than the Burning River. It doesn't seem to help.

[[The gold spikes are grinding ever-lower towards you.|afternoon]]

[[<font color = "#D72B8C">Scottify</font>|clear your desktop]]
